summary: Internal email correspondence from the Metropolitan Correctional Center regarding inmate Jeffrey Epstein's cell conditions. The email, sent by the Chief Psychologist, instructs staff to move Epstein from a cell with a broken toilet to a different cell upon his return from a legal conference.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate referenced by number #76318-054, who is to be moved from a cell with a broken toilet in the Psych Observation area.

persons.name: Chief Psychologist
persons.context: Author of the email instructing staff to move inmate Epstein to a different cell due to a non-working toilet.

connections.description: The Chief Psychologist is issuing instructions regarding the housing conditions for inmate Epstein.

events.title: Observation of Broken Toilet
events.description: An observation was made that the toilet may not be correctly working in cell #4 in the Psych Observation area where Epstein was housed.

events.title: Instruction to Move Epstein
events.description: The Chief Psychologist sends an email instructing staff to move inmate Epstein to a different cell upon his return from an Attorney Conference due to the broken toilet.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The document is an email dated July 29, 2019, concerning inmate Jeffrey Epstein's conditions at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.
Epstein was housed in a cell (#4 in the Psych Observation area) with a broken toilet that was reported as not correctly working.
The Chief Psychologist instructed staff to move Epstein to a different cell upon his return from an Attorney Conference.
The email indicates Epstein was still in custody and attending legal conferences as of late July 2019.
